results.title: Safe for life (E)
results.creator_credit: Liller Moller, Svend Johansen, Denmark. National Board of Health and Filmforsyningen
results.brief_description: The AIDS epidemic is one which affects both the heterosexual and homosexual community - and being young isn’t a guarantee of immunity, in fact the young are probably one of the most vulnerable groups. Using clever animation, this production broaches the topic of AIDS prevention through the careful use of the condom, the only known way of avoiding the disease. WARNING: THE MATERIAL IS VISUALLY EXPLICIT.

results.title: Sadness: a monologue by William Yang
results.creator_credit: Tony Ayres, Megan McMurchy, Michael McMahon and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Based on photographer William Yang’s one man stage show, “Sadness” chronicles two diverging narratives through the use of slide photography, oral history and stylised recreation. One story follows Yang’s pilgrimage into the heart of the North Queensland sugar cane fields as he investigates the murder of his uncle Fang Yuen. The other is a series of moving portraits of the many friends and lovers Yang has lost to AIDS. Director Tony Ayres skillfully weaves these two separate stories together creating a powerful testament to family, friends, love and loss. Cinematography by Tristan Milani. Narrated by William Yang.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Ayres, Megan McMurchy, Michael McMahon and Film Australia

results.title: Sacred vandals
results.creator_credit: Solrun Hoaas, Australian Film Commission. Creative Development Branch and Japan Foundation
results.brief_description: A film about women who follow their obsessions, taking dreams and illnesses as signs that they must find places in nature - rocks, trees, groves - that have special connection with their ancestors. They challenge the established order of things on the small depopulated island of Hatoma (Japan) and exert their spiritual power and leadership through subversive means. Focuses on three women, all of whom left the island long ago, but still retain a strong attachment to it, and who return to it regularly to perform their rituals.

results.title: S.O.S.: save our sons
results.creator_credit: Rebecca McLean, Elisa Argenzio and S O S Pictures Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: The gaoling of the ‘Fairlea Five’ was the first many Australians had heard of the Save our Sons movement; a group of women formed in the sixties to protest against the Vietnam War. S.O.S explores the motivation of this group of women, charting their progress from their unpopular beginnings in 1965, to the moratoriums and re-election of the Labour Party in 1972. The film uses interviews, original footage and news clippings to illustrate their strategies (both conventional and non-conventional), specific areas of protest (including anti-conscription and conscientious objecting), and their achievements over this time.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rebecca McLean, Elisa Argenzio and S O S Pictures Pty Ltd

results.title: S.O.S. iceberg
results.brief_description: The story of Dr Karl Laurence, an explorer who in the interest of Arctic research, set off to carry on the scientific investigation with the North Pole. A short film which has some great special effects with the iceberg.

results.title: Ryokan: a Japanese-style hotel
results.creator_credit: Japan. National Tourist Organisation and Shu Taguchi Productions

results.title: Rust bucket
results.brief_description: A family deliberates over the financial difficulties of having their family station wagon repaired. Knowing that the car is insured for the full amount, they call on the services of a friend, with shocking results.

results.title: Russian rooster
results.brief_description: The wild chase of hunters after a rooster becomes even more frenzied with background music of Rimsky - Korsakoffs “La Coq D’or”. The combination of music and animated figures drawn directly on the film creates an exciting visual experience. And don’t be so sure about who wins the chase.

results.title: Russia: an introduction
results.brief_description: An introduction to Russian history from Peter the Great to the October Revolution. It also surveys the geography of this vast land, contemporary life in the country and cities and we visit the two main cities of Moscow and Leningrad.
